flexibleengine-compute-bms-flavors-v2.body:
data "flexibleengine_compute_bms_flavors_v2" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) - The name of the BMS flavor.
    name = ""

    # id - (Optional) - The BMS flavor id.
    id = ""

    # min_ram - (Optional) - The minimum memory size in MB. Only the BMSs with the memory size greater than or equal to the minimum size can be queried.
    min_ram = ""

    # min_disk - (Optional) - The minimum disk size in GB. Only the BMSs with a disk size greater than or equal to the minimum size can be queried.
    min_disk = ""

    # sort_key - (Optional) - The sorting field. The default value is **flavorid**. The other values are **name**, **memory_mb**, **vcpus**, **root_gb**, or **flavorid**.
    sort_key = ""

    # sort_dir - (Optional) - The sorting order, which can be **ascending** (**asc**) or **descending** (**desc**). The default value is **asc**.
    sort_dir = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "ram" - It is the memory size (in MB) of the flavor.
    # "vcpus" - It is the number of CPU cores in the BMS flavor.
    # "disk" - Specifies the disk size (GB) in the BMS flavor.
    # "swap" -  This is a reserved attribute.
    # "rx_tx_factor" - This is a reserved attribute.
}
flexibleengine-compute-bms-flavors-v2.description: `flexibleengine_compute_bms_flavors_v2` used to query flavors of BMSs.

flexibleengine-compute-bms-server-v2.body:
data "flexibleengine_compute_bms_server_v2" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) - The unique ID of the BMS.
    id = ""

    # user_id - (Optional) - The ID of the user to which the BMS belongs.
    user_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) - The name of BMS.
    name = ""

    # status - (Optional) - The BMS status.
    status = ""

    # host_status - (Optional) - The nova-compute status: **UP, UNKNOWN, DOWN, MAINTENANCE** and **Null**.
    host_status = ""

    # key_name - (Optional) - It is the SSH key name.
    key_name = ""

    # flavor_id - (Optional) - It gives the BMS flavor information.
    flavor_id = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) - The BMS image.
    image_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "host_id" - 	It is the host ID of the BMS.
    # "progress" - This is a reserved attribute.
    # "metadata" -  The BMS metadata is specified.
    # "access_ip_v4" -  This is a reserved attribute.
    # "access_ip_v6" - This is a reserved attribute.  
    # "addresses" - It gives the BMS network address.
    # "security_groups" - The list of security groups to which the BMS belongs.
    # "tags" - Specifies the BMS tag.
    # "locked" -  It specifies whether a BMS is locked, true: The BMS is locked, false: The BMS is not locked.
    # "config_drive" -  This is a reserved attribute.
    # "availability_zone" - Specifies the AZ ID.
    # "description" -  Provides supplementary information about the pool.
    # "kernel_id" - The UUID of the kernel image when the AMI image is used.
    # "hypervisor_hostname" -  It is the name of a host on the hypervisor.
    # "instance_name" - Instance name is specified.
}
flexibleengine-compute-bms-server-v2.description: `flexibleengine_compute_bms_server_v2` used to query a BMS or BMSs details.

flexibleengine-datasource-rts-stack-v1.body:
data "flexibleengine_rts_stack_v1" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the stack.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - A unique identifier of the stack.
    # "capabilities" - List of stack capabilities for stack.
    # "notification_topics" - List of notification topics for stack.
    # "status" - Specifies the stack status.
    # "disable_rollback" - Whether the rollback of the stack is disabled when stack creation fails.
    # "outputs" - A list of stack outputs.
    # "parameters" - A map of parameters that specify input parameters for the stack.
    # "template_body" - Structure containing the template body.
    # "timeout_mins" - Specifies the timeout duration.
}
flexibleengine-datasource-rts-stack-v1.description: The FlexibleEngine RTS Stack data source allows access to stack outputs and other useful data including the template body.

flexibleengine-datasource-s3-bucket-obje.body:
data "flexibleengine_s3_bucket_object" "$1" {
    # key - (Required) The full path to the object inside the bucket
    key = ""

    # bucket - (Required) The name of the bucket to read the object from
    bucket = ""

    # range - (Optional) Obtains the specified range bytes of an object. The value is a range starting from 0 to maximum object length minus one. If the range is invalid, all object data is returned.
    range = ""

    # version_id - (Optional) Specific version ID of the object returned (defaults to latest version)
    version_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "body" - Object data (see **limitations above** to understand cases in which this field is actually available)
    # "cache_control" - Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
    # "content_disposition" - Specifies presentational information for the object.
    # "content_encoding" - Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.
    # "content_language" - The language the content is in.
    # "content_length" - Size of the body in bytes.
    # "content_type" - A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
    # "etag" - [ETag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_ETag) generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content in case it's not encrypted)
    # "expiration" - If the object expiration is configured, the field includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id key value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of the rule-id is URL encoded.
    # "expires" - The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
    # "last_modified" - Last modified date of the object in RFC1123 format (e.g. "Mon, 02 Jan 2006 15:04:05 MST")
    # "metadata" - A map of metadata stored with the object in S3
    # "server_side_encryption" - If the object is stored using server-side encryption (KMS or Amazon S3-managed encryption key), this field includes the chosen encryption and algorithm used.
    # "sse_kms_key_id" - If present, specifies the ID of the Key Management Service (KMS) master encryption key that was used for the object.
    # "website_redirect_location" - If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL. S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.
}
flexibleengine-datasource-s3-bucket-obje.description:
The S3 object data source allows access to the metadata and
_optionally_ (see below) content of an object stored inside S3 bucket. ~> **Note:** The content of an object (`body` field) is available only for objects which have a human-readable `Content-Type` (`text/*` and `application/json`). This is to prevent printing unsafe characters and potentially downloading large amount of data which would be thrown away in favour of metadata.

flexibleengine-datasource-sfs-file-syste.body:
data "flexibleengine_sfs_file_system_v2" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) The name of the shared file system.
    name = ""

    # id - (Optional) The UUID of the shared file system.
    id = ""

    # status - (Optional) The status of the shared file system.
    status = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "availability_zone" - The availability zone name.
    # "size" - 	The size (GB) of the shared file system.
    # "share_type" - The storage service type for the shared file system, such as high-performance storage (composed of SSDs) or large-capacity storage (composed of SATA disks).
    # "status" - The status of the shared file system.
    # "host" - The host name of the shared file system.
    # "is_public" - The level of visibility for the shared file system.
    # "share_proto" - The protocol for sharing file systems.
    # "volume_type" - The volume type.
    # "metadata" - Metadata key and value pairs as a dictionary of strings.
    # "export_location" - The path for accessing the shared file system.
    # "export_locations" - The list of mount locations.
    # "access_level" - The level of the access rule.
    # "access_rules_status" - The status of the share access rule.
    # "access_type" - The type of the share access rule.
    # "access_to" - The access that the back end grants or denies.
    # "state" - The status of the access rule.
    # "share_access_id" - The UUID of the share access rule.
    # "mount_id" - The UUID of the mount location of the shared file system.
    # "share_instance_id" - The access that the back end grants or denies.
    # "preferred" - Identifies which mount locations are most efficient and are used preferentially when multiple mount locations exist.
}
flexibleengine-datasource-sfs-file-syste.description: Provides information about an Shared File System (SFS).

flexibleengine-datasource-subnet-ids-v1.description: `flexibleengine_vpc_subnet_ids_v1` provides a list of subnet ids for a vpc_id This resource can be useful for getting back a list of subnet ids for a vpc.

flexibleengine-datasource-vbs-backup-pol.body:
data "flexibleengine_vbs_backup_policy_v2" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) - The ID of the specific VBS backup policy to retrieve.
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) - The name of the specific VBS backup policy to retrieve.
    name = ""

    # status - (Optional) - The status of the specific VBS backup policy to retrieve. The values can be ON or OFF
    status = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "start_time" - Specifies the start time of the backup job.The value is in the HH:mm format.                                                         
    # "retain_first_backup" - Specifies whether to retain the first backup in the current month. 
    # "rentention_num" - Specifies number of retained backups.
    # "frequency" - Specifies the backup interval. The value is in the range of 1 to 14 days.
    # "policy_resource_count" - Specifies the number of volumes associated with the backup policy.
}
flexibleengine-datasource-vbs-backup-pol.description: The VBS Backup Policy data source provides details about a specific VBS backup policy.

flexibleengine-datasource-vbs-backup-v2.description: VBS Backup can be imported using the `backup id`, e.g.  $ terraform import flexibleengine_vbs_backup_v2.mybackup 4779ab1c-7c1a-44b1-a02e-93dfc361b32d

flexibleengine-datasource-vpc-peering-v2.body:
data "flexibleengine_vpc_peering_connection_v2" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) - The ID of the specific VPC Peering Connection to retrieve.
    id = ""

    # status - (Optional) - The status of the specific VPC Peering Connection to retrieve.
    status = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) - The ID of the requester VPC of the specific VPC Peering Connection to retrieve.
    vpc_id = ""

    peer_vpc_id = ""

flexibleengine-datasource-vpc-peering-v2.description: The VPC Peering Connection data source provides details about a specific VPC peering connection.

flexibleengine-datasource-vpc-route-ids-.description: `flexibleengine_vpc_route_ids_v2` provides a list of route ids for a vpc_id. This resource can be useful for getting back a list of route ids for a vpc.

flexibleengine-datasource-vpc-route-v2.body:
data "flexibleengine_vpc_route_v2" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) - The id of the specific route to retrieve.
    id = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) - The id of the VPC that the desired route belongs to.
    vpc_id = ""

    # destination - (Optional) - The route destination address (CIDR).
    destination = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) - Only the administrator can specify the tenant ID of other tenants.
    tenant_id = ""

    # type - (Optional) - Route type for filtering.
    type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
flexibleengine-datasource-vpc-route-v2.description: `flexibleengine_vpc_route_v2` provides details about a specific VPC route.

flexibleengine-datasource-vpc-subnet-v1.body:
data "flexibleengine_vpc_subnet_v1" "$1" {
    # id - (Optional) - Specifies a resource ID in UUID format.
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) - The name of the specific subnet to retrieve.
    name = ""

    # cidr - (Optional) - The network segment of specific subnet to retrieve. The value must be in CIDR format.
    cidr = ""

    # status - (Optional) - The value can be ACTIVE, DOWN, UNKNOWN, or ERROR.
    status = ""

    # vpc_id - (Optional) - The id of the VPC that the desired subnet belongs to.
    vpc_id = ""

    # gateway_ip - (Optional) - The subnet gateway address of specific subnet.
    gateway_ip = ""

    # primary_dns - (Optional) - The IP address of DNS server 1 on the specific subnet.
    primary_dns = ""

    # secondary_dns - (Optional) - The IP address of DNS server 2 on the specific subnet.
    secondary_dns = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) - The availability zone (AZ) to which the subnet should belong.
    availability_zone = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
flexibleengine-datasource-vpc-subnet-v1.description:
`flexibleengine_vpc_subnet_v1` provides details about a specific VPC subnet. This resource can prove useful when a module accepts a subnet id as
an input variable and needs to, for example, determine the id of the
VPC that the subnet belongs to.

flexibleengine-datasource-vpc-v1.body:
data "flexibleengine_vpc_v1" "$1" {
    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V1 VPC client. A VPC client is needed to retrieve VPCs. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.
    region = ""

    # id - (Optional) The id of the specific VPC to retrieve.
    id = ""

    # status - (Optional) The current status of the desired VPC. Can be either CREATING, OK, DOWN, PENDING_UPDATE, PENDING_DELETE, or ERROR.
    status = ""

    # name - (Optional) A unique name for the VPC. The name must be unique for a tenant. The value is a string of no more than 64 characters and can contain digits, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # cidr - (Optional) The cidr block of the desired VPC.
    cidr = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - ID of the VPC.
    # "cidr" - (Optional) The cidr block of the desired VPC.
    # "name" -  See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "cidr" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "routes" - The list of route information with destination and nexthop fields.
    # "shared" - Specifies whether the cross-tenant sharing is supported.
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
}
flexibleengine-datasource-vpc-v1.description: flexibleengine_vpc_v1 provides details about a specific VPC. This resource can prove useful when a module accepts a vpc id as an input variable and needs to, for example, determine the CIDR block of that VPC.

flexibleengine-resource-antiddos-v1.body:
resource "flexibleengine_antiddos_v1" "$1" {
    # floating_ip_id - (Required) The ID corresponding to the Elastic IP Address (EIP) of a user.
    floating_ip_id = ""

    # app_type_id - (Required) The application type ID. 
    app_type_id = ""

    # cleaning_access_pos_id - (Required) 
    cleaning_access_pos_id = ""

    # http_request_pos_id - (Required) The position ID of number of HTTP requests. The value ranges from 1 to 15.
    http_request_pos_id = ""

    # traffic_pos_id - (Required) The position ID of traffic. The value ranges from 1 to 9.
    traffic_pos_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
flexibleengine-resource-antiddos-v1.description: Anti-DDoS monitors the service traffic from the Internet to ECSs, ELB instances, and BMSs to detect attack traffic in real time. It then cleans attack traffic according to user-configured defense policies so that services run as normal.

flexibleengine-resource-as-configuration.body:
resource "flexibleengine_as_configuration_v1" "$1" {
    # charging_mode - (Required) The bandwidth charging mode. The system only supports `traffic`.
    charging_mode = ""

    # share_type - (Required) The bandwidth sharing type. The system only supports `PER` (indicates exclusive bandwidth).
    share_type = ""

    # size - (Required) The bandwidth (Mbit/s). The value range is 1 to 300.
    size = ""

    # bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth information. The structure is described below.
    bandwidth = ""

    # ip_type - (Required) The IP address type. The system only supports `5_bgp` (indicates dynamic BGP).
    ip_type = ""

    # contents - (Required) The content of the injected file, which must be encoded with base64.
    contents = ""

    # eip - (Required) The configuration parameter for creating an elastic IP address
    eip = ""

    # contents - (Required) The content of the injected file, which must be encoded with base64.
    contents = ""

    # path - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.
    path = ""

    # disk_type - (Required) Whether the disk is a system disk or a data disk. Option `DATA` indicates   a data disk. option `SYS` indicates a system disk.
    disk_type = ""

    # volume_type - (Required) The disk type, which must be the same as the disk type available in the system.   The options include `SATA` (common I/O disk type) and `SSD` (ultra-high I/O disk type).
    volume_type = ""

    # size - (Required) The disk size. The unit is GB. The system disk size ranges from 1 to 32768,   and the data disk size ranges from 10 to 32768.
    size = ""

    # key_name - (Required) The name of the SSH key pair used to log in to the instance.
    key_name = ""

    # instance_config - (Required) The information about instance configurations. The instance_config   dictionary data structure is documented below.
    instance_config = ""

    # scaling_configuration_name - (Required) The name of the AS configuration. The name can contain letters,   digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-), and cannot exceed 64 characters.
    scaling_configuration_name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS configuration. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new AS configuration.
    region = ""

    # instance_id - (Optional) When using the existing instance specifications as the template to   create AS configurations, specify this argument. In this case, flavor, image,   and disk arguments do not take effect. If the instance_id argument is not specified,   flavor, image, and disk arguments are mandatory.
    instance_id = ""

    # flavor - (Optional) The flavor ID.
    flavor = ""

    # image - (Optional) The image ID.
    image = ""

    # disk - (Optional) The disk group information. System disks are mandatory and data disks are optional.   The dick structure is described below.
    disk = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.   The file content must be encoded with Base64.
    user_data = ""

    # personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by   defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure   is described below.
    personality = ""

    # public_ip - (Optional) The elastic IP address of the instance. The public_ip structure   is described below.
    public_ip = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from   within the instance.
    metadata = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
flexibleengine-resource-as-configuration.description: Manages a V1 AS Configuration resource within flexibleengine.

flexibleengine-resource-as-group-v1.body:
resource "flexibleengine_as_group_v1" "$1" {
    # id - (Required) The UUID of the security group.
    id = ""

    # id - (Required) The network UUID.
    id = ""

    # vpc_id - (Required) The VPC ID. Changing this creates a new group.
    vpc_id = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) An array of one or more security group IDs   to associate with the group. The security_groups object structure is   documented below.
    security_groups = ""

    # networks - (Required) An array of one or more network IDs.   The system supports up to five networks. The networks object structure   is documented below.
    networks = ""

    # scaling_group_name - (Required) The name of the scaling group. The name can contain letters,   digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.
    scaling_group_name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS group. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new AS group.
    region = ""

    # scaling_configuration_id - (Optional) The configuration ID which defines   configurations of instances in the AS group.
    scaling_configuration_id = ""

    # desire_instance_number - (Optional) The expected number of instances. The default   value is the minimum number of instances. The value ranges from the minimum number of   instances to the maximum number of instances.
    desire_instance_number = ""

    # min_instance_number - (Optional) The minimum number of instances.   The default value is 0.
    min_instance_number = ""

    # max_instance_number - (Optional) The maximum number of instances.   The default value is 0.
    max_instance_number = ""

    # cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds). The value ranges   from 0 to 86400, and is 900 by default.
    cool_down_time = ""

    # lb_listener_id - (Optional) The ELB listener IDs. The system supports up to   three ELB listeners, the IDs of which are separated using a comma (,).
    lb_listener_id = ""

    # available_zones - (Optional) The availability zones in which to create   the instances in the autoscaling group.
    available_zones = ""

    # health_periodic_audit_method - (Optional) The health check method for instances   in the AS group. The health check methods include `ELB_AUDIT` and `NOVA_AUDIT`.   If load balancing is configured, the default value of this parameter is `ELB_AUDIT`.   Otherwise, the default value is `NOVA_AUDIT`.
    health_periodic_audit_method = ""

    # health_periodic_audit_time - (Optional) The health check period for instances.   The period has four options: 5 minutes (default), 15 minutes, 60 minutes, and 180 minutes.
    health_periodic_audit_time = ""

    # instance_terminate_policy - (Optional) The instance removal policy. The policy has   four options: `OLD_CONFIG_OLD_INSTANCE` (default), `OLD_CONFIG_NEW_INSTANCE`,   `OLD_INSTANCE`, and `NEW_INSTANCE`.
    instance_terminate_policy = ""

    # notifications - (Optional) The notification mode. The system only supports `EMAIL`   mode which refers to notification by email.
    notifications = ""

    # delete_publicip - (Optional) Whether to delete the elastic IP address bound to the   instances of AS group when deleting the instances. The options are `true` and `false`.
    delete_publicip = ""

    # delete_instances - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are `yes` and `no`.
    delete_instances = ""

    # delete_instances - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are `yes` and `no`.
    delete_instances = ""

    # delete_instances - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are `yes` and `no`.
    delete_instances = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "scaling_group_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "desire_instance_number" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "min_instance_number" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "max_instance_number" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "cool_down_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "lb_listener_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "health_periodic_audit_method" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "health_periodic_audit_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "instance_terminate_policy" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "scaling_configuration_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "delete_publicip" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "notifications" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "instances" - The instances IDs of the AS group.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
}
flexibleengine-resource-as-group-v1.description: Manages a V1 Autoscaling Group resource within flexibleengine.

flexibleengine-resource-as-policy-v1.body:
resource "flexibleengine_as_policy_v1" "$1" {
    # launch_time - (Required) The time when the scaling action is triggered. If `scaling_policy_type`   is set to `SCHEDULED`, the time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ. If `scaling_policy_type` is set to   `RECURRENCE`, the time format is hh:mm.
    launch_time = ""

    # scaling_policy_type - (Required) The AS policy type. The values can be `ALARM`, `SCHEDULED`,   and `RECURRENCE`.
    scaling_policy_type = ""

    # scaling_group_id - (Required) The AS group ID. Changing this creates a new AS policy.
    scaling_group_id = ""

    # scaling_policy_name - (Required) The name of the AS policy. The name can contain letters,   digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.
    scaling_policy_name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS policy. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new AS policy.
    region = ""

    # alarm_id - (Optional) The alarm rule ID. This argument is mandatory   when `scaling_policy_type` is set to `ALARM`.
    alarm_id = ""

    # scheduled_policy - (Optional) The periodic or scheduled AS policy. This argument is mandatory   when `scaling_policy_type` is set to `SCHEDULED` or `RECURRENCE`. The scheduled_policy structure   is documented below.
    scheduled_policy = ""

    # scaling_policy_action - (Optional) The action of the AS policy. The scaling_policy_action   structure is documented below.
    scaling_policy_action = ""

    # cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds), and is 900 by default.
    cool_down_time = ""

    # recurrence_type - (Optional) The periodic triggering type. This argument is mandatory when   `scaling_policy_type` is set to `RECURRENCE`. The options include `Daily`, `Weekly`, and `Monthly`.
    recurrence_type = ""

    # recurrence_value - (Optional) The frequency at which scaling actions are triggered.
    recurrence_value = ""

    # start_time - (Optional) The start time of the scaling action triggered periodically.   The time format complies with UTC. The current time is used by default. The time   format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.
    start_time = ""

    # end_time - (Optional) The end time of the scaling action triggered periodically.   The time format complies with UTC. This argument is mandatory when `scaling_policy_type`   is set to `RECURRENCE`. The time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.
    end_time = ""

    # operation - (Optional) The operation to be performed. The options include `ADD` (default), `REMOVE`,   and `SET`.
    operation = ""

    # instance_number - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    instance_number = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scaling_policy_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scaling_policy_type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "alarm_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "cool_down_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scaling_policy_action/operation" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scaling_policy_action/instance_number" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/launch_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/recurrence_type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/recurrence_value" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/start_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/end_time" - See Argument Reference above.

flexibleengine-resource-ces-alarmrule.body:
resource "flexibleengine_ces-alarmrule" "$1" {
    # notification_list - (Required) specifies the topic urn list of the target   notification objects. the maximum length is 5. the topic urn list can be   obtained from simple message notification (smn) and in the following format:   urn: smn:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|\-){1,32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]){32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|\-|\_){1,256}.   if type is set to notification, the value of notification_list cannot be   empty. if type is set to autoscaling, the value of notification_list must   be [] and the value of namespace must be sys.as.   Note: to enable the as alarm rules take effect, you must bind scaling   policies. for details, see the auto scaling api reference.
    notification_list = ""

    # count - (Required) Specifies the number of consecutive occurrence times.   The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    count = ""

    # value - (Required) Specifies the alarm threshold. The value ranges from   0 to Number of 1.7976931348623157e+308.
    value = ""

    # comparison_operator - (Required) Specifies the comparison condition of alarm   thresholds. The value can be >, =, <, >=, or <=.
    comparison_operator = ""

    # filter - (Required) Specifies the data rollup methods. The value can be   max, min, average, sum, and vaiance.
    filter = ""

    # period - (Required) Specifies the alarm checking period in seconds. The   value can be 1, 300, 1200, 3600, 14400, and 86400.   Note: If period is set to 1, the raw metric data is used to determine   whether to generate an alarm.
    period = ""

    # value - (Required) Specifies the dimension value. The value can be a string   of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter or a number and can consists   of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens   (-).
    value = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the dimension name. The value can be a string   of 1 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase   letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # dimensions - (Required) Specifies the list of metric dimensions. Currently,   the maximum length of the dimesion list that are supported is 3. The structure   is described below.
    dimensions = ""

    # metric_name - (Required) Specifies the metric name. The value can be a string   of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase   letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).
    metric_name = ""

    # namespace - (Required) Specifies the namespace in service.item format. service.item   can be a string of 3 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can   consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).
    namespace = ""

    # condition - (Required) Specifies the alarm triggering condition. The structure   is described below.
    condition = ""

    # metric - (Required) Specifies the alarm metrics. The structure is described   below.
    metric = ""

    # alarm_name - (Required) Specifies the name of an alarm rule. The value can   be a string of 1 to 128 characters that can consist of numbers, lowercase letters,   uppercase letters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
    alarm_name = ""

    # alarm_description - (Optional) The value can be a string of 0 to 256 characters.
    alarm_description = ""

    # alarm_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action list triggered by an alarm. The   structure is described below.
    alarm_actions = ""

    # insufficientdata_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action list triggered by   data insufficiency. The structure is described below.
    insufficientdata_actions = ""

    # ok_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action list triggered by the clearing of   an alarm. The structure is described below.
    ok_actions = ""

    # alarm_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the alarm. The default   value is true.
    alarm_enabled = ""

    # alarm_action_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the action   to be triggered by an alarm. The default value is true.   Note: If alarm_action_enabled is set to true, at least one of the following   parameters alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions cannot   be empty. If alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions coexist,   their corresponding notification_list must be of the same value.
    alarm_action_enabled = ""

    # unit - (Optional) Specifies the data unit.
    unit = ""

    # type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the   value can be notification or autoscaling.   notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.   autoscaling: indicates that a scaling action will be triggered.
    type = ""

    # type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the   value is notification.   notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.
    type = ""

    # notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    notification_list = ""

    # type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the   value is notification.   notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.
    type = ""

    # notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    notification_list = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "alarm_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "metric" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "condition" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_actions" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "insufficientdata_actions" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "ok_actions" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_enabled" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_action_enabled" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "id" - Specifies the alarm rule ID.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "update_time" - Specifies the time when the alarm status changed. The value
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_state" - Specifies the alarm status. The value can be:
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
}

flexibleengine-resource-compute-bms-serv.body:
resource "flexibleengine_compute_bms_server_v2" "$1" {
    # availability_zone - (Required) The availability zone in which to create   the bms server.
    availability_zone = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the BMS.
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the bms server instance. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new bms server.
    region = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_name` is empty.) Changing this creates a new bms server.
    image_id = ""

    # image_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_id` is empty.) The name of the   desired image for the bms server. Changing this creates a new bms server.
    image_name = ""

    # flavor_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_name` is empty) The flavor ID of   the desired flavor for the bms server. Changing this resizes the existing bms server.
    flavor_id = ""

    # flavor_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_id` is empty) The name of the   desired flavor for the bms server. Changing this resizes the existing bms server.
    flavor_name = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.   Changing this creates a new bms server.
    user_data = ""

    # security_groups - (Optional) An array of one or more security group names   to associate with the bms server. Changing this results in adding/removing   security groups from the existing bms server.
    security_groups = ""

    # network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the   bms instance. Changing this creates a new bms server.
    network = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from   within the instance. Changing this updates the existing bms server metadata.
    metadata = ""

    # admin_pass - (Optional) The administrative password to assign to the bms server.   Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.
    admin_pass = ""

    # key_pair - (Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the bms server. The key   pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account.   Changing this creates a new bms server.
    key_pair = ""

    # stop_before_destroy - (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully   before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly.   If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.
    stop_before_destroy = ""

    # uuid - (Optional) (Required unless `port`  or `name` is provided) The network UUID to   attach to the bms server. Changing this creates a new bms server.
    uuid = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `port` is provided) The human-readable   name of the network. Changing this creates a new bms server.
    name = ""

    # port - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `name` is provided) The port UUID of a   network to attach to the bms server. Changing this creates a new server.
    port = ""

    # access_network - (Optional) Specifies if this network should be used for   provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.
    access_network = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
flexibleengine-resource-compute-bms-serv.description: In addition to all arguments above, the following attributes are exported: `id` - The id of the bms server. `config_drive` - Whether to use the config_drive feature to configure the instance. `kernel_id` - The UUID of the kernel image when the AMI image is used. `user_id` - The ID of the user to which the BMS belongs. `host_status` - The nova-compute status: **UP, UNKNOWN, DOWN, MAINTENANCE** and **Null**.

flexibleengine-resource-compute-floating.description:
Associate a floating IP to an instance. This can be used instead of the
`floating_ip` options in `flexibleengine_compute_instance_v2`.

flexibleengine-resource-compute-floating.body:
resource "flexibleengine_compute_floatingip_v2" "$1" {
    # pool - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    pool = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.   A Compute client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with   a compute instance. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider   is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not   have a different address).
    region = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    # "pool" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    # "address" - The actual floating IP address itself.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    # "fixed_ip" - The fixed IP address corresponding to the floating IP.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    # "instance_id" - UUID of the compute instance associated with the floating IP.
    # "pool" - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
}
flexibleengine-resource-compute-floating.description:
Manages a V2 floating IP resource within FlexibleEngine Nova (compute)
that can be used for compute instances.
These are similar to Neutron (networking) floating IP resources,
but only networking floating IPs can be used with load balancers.

flexibleengine-resource-compute-instance.body:
resource "flexibleengine_compute_instance_v2" "$1" {
    # contents - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    contents = ""

    # file - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.
    file = ""

    # source_type - (Required) The source type of the device. Must be one of   "blank", "image", "volume", or "snapshot". Changing this creates a new   server.
    source_type = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the server instance. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new server.
    region = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_name` is empty and not booting   from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The image ID of   the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    image_id = ""

    # image_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_id` is empty and not booting   from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The name of the   desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    image_name = ""

    # flavor_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_name` is empty) The flavor ID of   the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.
    flavor_id = ""

    # flavor_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_id` is empty) The name of the   desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.
    flavor_name = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.   Changing this creates a new server.
    user_data = ""

    # security_groups - (Optional) An array of one or more security group names   to associate with the server. Changing this results in adding/removing   security groups from the existing server. *Note*: When attaching the   instance to networks using Ports, place the security groups on the Port   and not the instance.
    security_groups = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone in which to create   the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    availability_zone = ""

    # network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the   instance. The network object structure is documented below. Changing this   creates a new server.
    network = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from   within the instance. Changing this updates the existing server metadata.
    metadata = ""

    # config_drive - (Optional) Whether to use the config_drive feature to   configure the instance. Changing this creates a new server.
    config_drive = ""

    # admin_pass - (Optional) The administrative password to assign to the server.   Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.
    admin_pass = ""

    # key_pair - (Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the server. The key   pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account.   Changing this creates a new server.
    key_pair = ""

    # block_device - (Optional) Configuration of block devices. The block_device   structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server.   You can specify multiple block devices which will create an instance with   multiple disks. This configuration is very flexible, so please see the   following [reference](http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/block_device_mapping.html)   for more information.
    block_device = ""

    # scheduler_hints - (Optional) Provide the Nova scheduler with hints on how   the instance should be launched. The available hints are described below.
    scheduler_hints = ""

    # personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by   defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure   is described below.
    personality = ""

    # stop_before_destroy - (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully   before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly.   If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.
    stop_before_destroy = ""

    # force_delete - (Optional) Whether to force the FlexibleEngine instance to be   forcefully deleted. This is useful for environments that have reclaim / soft   deletion enabled.
    force_delete = ""

    # uuid - (Optional) (Required unless `port`  or `name` is provided) The network UUID to   attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    uuid = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `port` is provided) The human-readable   name of the network. Changing this creates a new server.
    name = ""

    # port - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `name` is provided) The port UUID of a   network to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    port = ""

    # access_network - (Optional) Specifies if this network should be used for   provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.
    access_network = ""

    # uuid - (Optional) (Required unless `source_type` is set to `"blank"` ) The UUID of   the image, volume, or snapshot. Changing this creates a new server.
    uuid = ""

    # volume_size - (Optional) The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Required   in the following combinations: source=image and destination=volume,   source=blank and destination=local, and source=blank and destination=volume.   Changing this creates a new server.
    volume_size = ""

    # volume_type - (Optional) Currently, the value can be `SSD` (ultra-I/O disk type),   `SAS` (high I/O disk type), or `SATA` (common I/O disk type)
    volume_type = ""

    # boot_index - (Optional) The boot index of the volume. It defaults to 0.   Changing this creates a new server.
    boot_index = ""

    # destination_type - (Optional) The type that gets created. Possible values   are "volume" and "local". Changing this creates a new server.
    destination_type = ""

    # delete_on_termination - (Optional) Delete the volume / block device upon   termination of the instance. Defaults to false. Changing this creates a   new server.
    delete_on_termination = ""

    # group - (Optional) A UUID of a Server Group. The instance will be placed   into that group.
    group = ""

    # different_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will   be scheduled on a different host than all other instances.
    different_host = ""

    # same_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be   scheduled on the same host of those specified.
    same_host = ""

    # query - (Optional) A conditional query that a compute node must pass in   order to host an instance.
    query = ""

    # target_cell - (Optional) The name of a cell to host the instance.
    target_cell = ""

    # build_near_host_ip - (Optional) An IP Address in CIDR form. The instance   will be placed on a compute node that is in the same subnet.
    build_near_host_ip = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.

    # backup_at - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    backup_at = ""

    period_type = ""

    # begin_at - (Required) Time at which backup starts. "00:00-01:00" indicates that backup   starts at 00:00:00.
    begin_at = ""

    # backup_type - (Required) Backup type. Options:   auto: automatic backup.   manual: manual backup.
    backup_type = ""

    # save_days - (Required) Retention time. Unit: day. Range: 1–7.
    save_days = ""

    # product_id - (Required) Product ID used to differentiate DCS instance types.
    product_id = ""

    # available_zones - (Required) IDs of the AZs where cache nodes reside. For details   on how to query AZs, see Querying AZ Information.

    security_group_id = ""

    vpc_id = ""

    # capacity - (Required) Indicates the Cache capacity. Unit: GB.   For a DCS Redis or Memcached instance in single-node or master/standby mode, the cache   capacity can be 2 GB, 4 GB, 8 GB, 16 GB, 32 GB, or 64 GB.   For a DCS Redis instance in cluster mode, the cache capacity can be 64, 128, 256, 512,   or 1024 GB.
    capacity = ""

    # engine - (Required) Indicates a cache engine. Only Redis is supported.
    engine = ""

    # name - (Required) Indicates the name of an instance. An instance name starts with a letter, 	consists of 4 to 64 characters, and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Indicates the description of an instance. It is a character   string containing not more than 1024 characters.
    description = ""

    # engine_version - (Optional) Indicates the version of a cache engine, which is 3.0.7.
    engine_version = ""

    # access_user - (Optional) Username used for accessing a DCS instance after password   authentication. A username starts with a letter, consists of 1 to 64 characters,   and supports only letters, digits, and hyphens (-).
    access_user = ""

    # password - (Optional) Password of a DCS instance.   The password of a DCS Redis instance must meet the following complexity requirements:
    password = ""

    # maintain_begin - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window starts.   Format: HH:mm:ss.   The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of 	a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows.   The start time must be set to 22:00, 02:00, 06:00, 10:00, 14:00, or 18:00.   Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_begin 	is left blank, parameter maintain_end is also blank. In this case, the system automatically 	allocates the default start time 02:00.
    maintain_begin = ""

    # maintain_end - (Optional) Indicates the time at which a maintenance time window ends.   Format: HH:mm:ss.   The start time and end time of a maintenance time window must indicate the time segment of 	a supported maintenance time window. For details, see section Querying Maintenance Time Windows.   The end time is four hours later than the start time. For example, if the start time is 22:00, 	the end time is 02:00.   Parameters maintain_begin and maintain_end must be set in pairs. If parameter maintain_end is left 	blank, parameter maintain_begin is also blank. In this case, the system automatically allocates 	the default end time 06:00.
    maintain_end = ""

    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "engine" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "engine_version" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "capacity" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "access_user" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "password" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "vpc_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "vpc_name" - Indicates the name of a vpc.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "security_group_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "security_group_name" - Indicates the name of a security group.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "subnet_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "subnet_name" - Indicates the name of a subnet.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "available_zones" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "product_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "maintain_begin" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "maintain_end" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "save_days" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.

    # "order_id" - An order ID is generated only in the monthly or yearly billing mode.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "port" - Port of the cache node.

    # "resource_spec_code" - Resource specifications.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.
    # "used_memory" - Size of the used memory. Unit: MB.
    # "backup_at" - (Required) Day in a week on which backup starts. Range: 1–7. Where: 1   indicates Monday; 7 indicates Sunday.

flexibleengine-resource-dws-cluster-v1.body:
resource "flexibleengine_dws_cluster_v1" "$1" {
    # vpc_id - (Required) VPC ID, which is used for configuring cluster network.
    vpc_id = ""

    # user_pwd - (Required) Administrator password for logging in to a data   warehouse cluster   A password must conform to the following rules:   Contains 8 to 32 characters.   Cannot be the same as the username or the username written in reverse   order.   Contains three types of the following:   Lowercase letters   Uppercase letters   Digits   Special characters ~!@#%^&*()-_=+|[{}];:,<.>/?
    user_pwd = ""

    # user_name - (Required) Administrator username for logging in to a data   warehouse cluster The administrator username must:   Consist of lowercase letters, digits, or underscores.   Start with a lowercase letter or an underscore.   Contain 1 to 63 characters.   Cannot be a keyword of the DWS database.
    user_name = ""

    # subnet_id - (Required) Subnet ID, which is used for configuring cluster   network.
    subnet_id = ""

    # security_group_id - (Required) ID of a security group. The ID is used for   configuring cluster network.
    security_group_id = ""

    # number_of_node - (Required) Number of nodes in a cluster. The value ranges   from 3 to 32.
    number_of_node = ""

    # node_type - (Required) Node type.
    node_type = ""

    # name - (Required) Cluster name, which must be unique and contains 4 to 64   characters, which consist of letters, digits, hyphens (-), or underscores   (_) only and must start with a letter.
    name = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) AZ in a cluster
    availability_zone = ""

    # port - (Optional) Service port of a cluster (8000 to 10000). The default   value is 8000.
    port = ""

    # public_ip - (Optional) Public IP address. If the value is not specified,   public connection is not used by default.
    public_ip = ""

    # eip_id - (Optional) EIP ID
    eip_id = ""

    # public_bind_type - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    public_bind_type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "public_bind_type" - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    # "number_of_node" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "public_bind_type" - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    # "availability_zone" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "public_bind_type" - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    # "subnet_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "public_bind_type" - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    # "user_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "public_bind_type" - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    # "security_group_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "public_bind_type" - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    # "public_ip" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "public_bind_type" - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    # "node_type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "public_bind_type" - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    # "vpc_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "public_bind_type" - (Optional) Binding type of an EIP. The value can be   either of the following:   auto_assign   not_use   bind_existing   The default value is not_use.
    # "port" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "created" - Cluster creation time. The format is   ISO8601:YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ.
    # "endpoints" - View the private network connection information about the   cluster.
    # "id" - Cluster ID
    # "public_endpoints" - Public network connection information about the cluster.   If the value is not specified, the public network connection information is   not used by default.
    # "status" - Cluster status, which can be one of the following:   CREATING   AVAILABLE   UNAVAILABLE   CREATION FAILED
    # "sub_status" - Sub-status of clusters in the AVAILABLE state. The value can   be one of the following:   NORMAL   READONLY   REDISTRIBUTING   REDISTRIBUTION-FAILURE   UNBALANCED   UNBALANCED | READONLY   DEGRADED   DEGRADED | READONLY   DEGRADED | UNBALANCED   UNBALANCED | REDISTRIBUTING   UNBALANCED | REDISTRIBUTION-FAILURE   READONLY | REDISTRIBUTION-FAILURE   UNBALANCED | READONLY | REDISTRIBUTION-FAILURE   DEGRADED | REDISTRIBUTION-FAILURE   DEGRADED | UNBALANCED | REDISTRIBUTION-FAILURE   DEGRADED | UNBALANCED | READONLY | REDISTRIBUTION-FAILURE   DEGRADED | UNBALANCED | READONLY
    # "task_status" - Cluster management task. The value can be one of the   following:   RESTORING   SNAPSHOTTING   GROWING   REBOOTING   SETTING_CONFIGURATION   CONFIGURING_EXT_DATASOURCE   DELETING_EXT_DATASOURCE   REBOOT_FAILURE   RESIZE_FAILURE
    # "updated" - Last modification time of a cluster. The format is   ISO8601:YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ.
    # "version" - Data warehouse version
    # "connect_info" - Private network connection information
    # "jdbc_url" - JDBC URL. The following is the default format:   jdbc:postgresql://< connect_info>/<YOUR_DATABASE_NAME>
    # "public_connect_info" - Public network connection information
    # "jdbc_url" - JDBC URL. The following is the default format:   jdbc:postgresql://< public_connect_info>/<YOUR_DATABASE_NAME>
}
flexibleengine-resource-dws-cluster-v1.description: Manages a DWS cluster resource within FlexibleEngine

flexibleengine-resource-elb-health.body:
resource "flexibleengine_elb_health" "$1" {
    # listener_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the listener to which the health   check task belongs.
    listener_id = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the elb health. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new elb health.
    region = ""

    # healthcheck_protocol - (Optional) Specifies the protocol used for the health   check. The value can be HTTP or TCP (case-insensitive).
    healthcheck_protocol = ""

    # healthcheck_uri - (Optional) Specifies the URI for health check. This parameter   is valid when healthcheck_ protocol is HTTP. The value is a string of 1 to 80   characters that must start with a slash (/) and can only contain letters, digits,   and special characters, such as -/.%?#&.
    healthcheck_uri = ""

    # healthcheck_connect_port - (Optional) Specifies the port used for the health   check. The value ranges from 1 to 65535.
    healthcheck_connect_port = ""

    # healthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health   check result is success, that is, the number of consecutive successful health   checks when the health check result of the backend server changes from fail   to success. The value ranges from 1 to 10.
    healthy_threshold = ""

    # unhealthy_threshold - (Optional) Specifies the threshold at which the health   check result is fail, that is, the number of consecutive failed health checks   when the health check result of the backend server changes from success to fail.   The value ranges from 1 to 10.
    unhealthy_threshold = ""

    # healthcheck_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the maximum timeout duration   (s) for the health check. The value ranges from 1 to 50.
    healthcheck_timeout = ""

    # healthcheck_interval - (Optional) Specifies the maximum interval (s) for   health check. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    healthcheck_interval = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "healthcheck_interval" - (Optional) Specifies the maximum interval (s) for   health check. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    # "listener_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "healthcheck_interval" - (Optional) Specifies the maximum interval (s) for   health check. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    # "healthcheck_protocol" - See Argument Reference above.

flexibleengine-resource-elb-listener.body:
resource "flexibleengine_elb_listener" "$1" {
    # lb_algorithm - (Required) Specifies the load balancing algorithm for the   listener. The value can be roundrobin, leastconn, or source.
    lb_algorithm = ""

    # backend_port - (Required) Specifies the backend port. The value ranges from   1 to 65535.
    backend_port = ""

    # backend_protocol - (Required) Specifies the backend protocol. If the value   of protocol is UDP, the value of this parameter can only be UDP. The value can   be HTTP, TCP, or UDP.
    backend_protocol = ""

    # protocol_port - (Required) Specifies the listening port. The value ranges from 1   to 65535.
    protocol_port = ""

    # protocol - (Required) Specifies the listening protocol used for layer 4   or 7. The value can be HTTP, TCP, HTTPS, or UDP.
    protocol = ""

    # loadbalancer_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the load balancer to which   the listener belongs.
    loadbalancer_id = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string   of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_), and   hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the elb listener. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new elb listener.
    region = ""

    # description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the listener.   The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.
    description = ""

    # session_sticky - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable sticky session.   The value can be true or false. The Sticky session is enabled when the value   is true, and is disabled when the value is false. If the value of protocol is   HTTP, HTTPS, or TCP, and the value of lb_algorithm is not roundrobin, the value   of this parameter can only be false.
    session_sticky = ""

    # sticky_session_type - (Optional) Specifies the cookie processing method.   The value is insert. insert indicates that the cookie is inserted by the load   balancer. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, and session_sticky   to true. The default value is insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol   is set to TCP or UDP, which means the parameter is empty.
    sticky_session_type = ""

    # cookie_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the cookie timeout period (minutes).   This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, session_sticky to true,   and sticky_session_type to insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol is   set to TCP or UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.
    cookie_timeout = ""

    # tcp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the TCP timeout period (minutes). This   parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    tcp_timeout = ""

    # tcp_draining - (Optional) Specifies whether to maintain the TCP connection   to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter is valid when protocol   is set to TCP. The value can be true or false.
    tcp_draining = ""

    # tcp_draining_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the timeout duration (minutes)   for the TCP connection to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter   is valid when protocol is set to TCP, and tcp_draining to true. The value ranges   from 0 to 60.
    tcp_draining_timeout = ""

    # certificate_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the SSL certificate used   for security authentication when HTTPS is used to make API calls. This parameter   is mandatory if the value of protocol is HTTPS. The value can be obtained by   viewing the details of the SSL certificate.
    certificate_id = ""

    # udp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the UDP timeout duration (minutes). This   parameter is valid when protocol is set to UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.
    udp_timeout = ""

    # ssl_protocols - (Optional) Specifies the SSL protocol standard supported   by a tracker, which is used for enabling specified encryption protocols. This   parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The value   is TLSv1.2 or TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 TLSv1. The default value is TLSv1.2.
    ssl_protocols = ""

    # ssl_ciphers - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    ssl_ciphers = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "loadbalancer_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "protocol" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. flexibleengine-resource-elb-loadbalancer.body:
resource "flexibleengine_elb_loadbalancer" "$1" {
    # admin_state_up - (Required) Specifies the status of the load balancer.   Value range: 0 or false: indicates that the load balancer is stopped. Only   tenants are allowed to enter these two values. 1 or true: indicates that   the load balancer is running properly. 2 or false: indicates that the load   balancer is frozen. Only tenants are allowed to enter these two values.
    admin_state_up = ""

    # type - (Required) Specifies the load balancer type. The value can be   Internal or External.
    type = ""

    # vpc_id - (Required) Specifies the VPC ID.
    vpc_id = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string   of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_),   and hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the loadbalancer. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new loadbalancer.
    region = ""

    # description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the   listener. The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.
    description = ""

    # bandwidth - (Optional) Specifies the bandwidth (Mbit/s). This parameter   is mandatory when type is set to External, and it is invalid when type   is set to Internal. The value ranges from 1 to 300.
    bandwidth = ""

    # vip_subnet_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the private network   to be added. This parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal,   and it is invalid when type is set to External.
    vip_subnet_id = ""

    # az - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the availability zone (AZ). This   parameter is mandatory when type is set to Internal, and it is invalid   when type is set to External.
    az = ""

    # security_group_id - (Optional) Specifies the security group ID. The   value is a string of 1 to 200 characters that consists of uppercase and   lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens (-). This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    security_group_id = ""

    # vip_address - (Optional) Specifies the IP address provided by ELB.   When type is set to External, the value of this parameter is the elastic   IP address. When type is set to Internal, the value of this parameter is   the private network IP address. You can select an existing elastic IP address   and create a public network load balancer. When this parameter is configured,   parameter bandwidth is invalid.
    vip_address = ""

    # tenantid - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    tenantid = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "vpc_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "bandwidth" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "admin_state_up" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "vip_subnet_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "az" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "security_group_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "vip_address" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "tenantid" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
    # "id" - Specifies the load balancer ID.
    # "tenantid" - (Optional) Specifies the tenant ID. This parameter is mandatory   only when type is set to Internal.
}
