resource "flexibleengine_fw_firewall_group_v2" "$1" {
    # description - (Required) A description for the firewall group. Changing this   updates the `description` of an existing firewall group.
    description = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the v2 networking client.   A networking client is needed to create a firewall group. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   firewall group.
    region = ""

    # ingress_policy_id - (Optional) The ingress policy resource id for the firewall group. Changing   this updates the `ingress_policy_id` of an existing firewall group.
    ingress_policy_id = ""

    # egress_policy_id - (Optional) The egress policy resource id for the firewall group. Changing   this updates the `egress_policy_id` of an existing firewall group.
    egress_policy_id = ""

    # name - (Optional) A name for the firewall group. Changing this   updates the `name` of an existing firewall group.
    name = ""

    # admin_state_up - (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the firewall group   (must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "true").   Changing this updates the `admin_state_up` of an existing firewall group.
    admin_state_up = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the floating IP. Required if admin wants   to create a firewall group for another tenant. Changing this creates a new   firewall group.
    tenant_id = ""

    # ports - (Optional) Port(s) to associate this firewall group instance   with. Must be a list of strings. Changing this updates the associated routers   of an existing firewall group.
    ports = ""

    # value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.

    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.

}

flexibleengine-resource-fw-policy-v2.body:
resource "flexibleengine_fw_policy_v2" "$1" {
    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the v2 networking client.   A networking client is needed to create a firewall policy. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   firewall policy.
    region = ""

    # name - (Optional) A name for the firewall policy. Changing this   updates the `name` of an existing firewall policy.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description for the firewall policy. Changing   this updates the `description` of an existing firewall policy.
    description = ""

    # rules - (Optional) An array of one or more firewall rules that comprise   the policy. Changing this results in adding/removing rules from the   existing firewall policy.
    rules = ""

    # audited - (Optional) Audit status of the firewall policy   (must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "false").   This status is set to "false" whenever the firewall policy or any of its   rules are changed. Changing this updates the `audited` status of an existing   firewall policy.
    audited = ""

    # shared - (Optional) Sharing status of the firewall policy (must be "true"   or "false" if provided). If this is "true" the policy is visible to, and   can be used in, firewalls in other tenants. Changing this updates the   `shared` status of an existing firewall policy. Only administrative users   can specify if the policy should be shared.
    shared = ""

    # value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    value_specs = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.

    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.

    # "audited" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    # "shared" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
}

    # action - (Required) Action to be taken ( must be "allow" or "deny") when the   firewall rule matches. Changing this updates the `action` of an existing   firewall rule.
    action = ""

    # protocol - (Required) The protocol type on which the firewall rule operates.   Valid values are: `tcp`, `udp`, `icmp`, and `any`. Changing this updates the   `protocol` of an existing firewall rule.
    protocol = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the v2 networking client.   A Compute client is needed to create a firewall rule. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   firewall rule.
    region = ""

    # name - (Optional) A unique name for the firewall rule. Changing this   updates the `name` of an existing firewall rule.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description for the firewall rule. Changing this   updates the `description` of an existing firewall rule.
    description = ""

    # ip_version - (Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this   updates the `ip_version` of an existing firewall rule.
    ip_version = ""

    # source_ip_address - (Optional) The source IP address on which the firewall   rule operates. Changing this updates the `source_ip_address` of an existing   firewall rule.
    source_ip_address = ""

    # destination_ip_address - (Optional) The destination IP address on which the   firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the `destination_ip_address`   of an existing firewall rule.
    destination_ip_address = ""

    # source_port - (Optional) The source port on which the firewall   rule operates. Changing this updates the `source_port` of an existing   firewall rule.
    source_port = ""

    # destination_port - (Optional) The destination port on which the firewall   rule operates. Changing this updates the `destination_port` of an existing   firewall rule.
    destination_port = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Enabled status for the firewall rule (must be "true"   or "false" if provided - defaults to "true"). Changing this updates the   `enabled` status of an existing firewall rule.
    enabled = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the firewall rule. Required if admin   wants to create a firewall rule for another tenant. Changing this creates a   new firewall rule.

flexibleengine-resource-images-image-v2.body:
resource "flexibleengine_images_image_v2" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the image.
    name = ""

    # disk_format - (Required) The disk format. Must be one of  "ami", "ari", "aki", "vhd", "vmdk", "raw", "qcow2", "vdi", "iso".
    disk_format = ""

    # container_format - (Required) The container format. Must be one of  "ami", "ari", "aki", "bare", "ovf".
    container_format = ""

    # local_file_path - (Optional) This is the filepath of the raw image file  that will be uploaded to Glance. Conflicts with `image_source_url`.
    local_file_path = ""

    # image_cache_path - (Optional) This is the directory where the images will  be downloaded. Images will be stored with a filename corresponding to  the url's md5 hash. Defaults to "$HOME/.terraform/image_cache"
    image_cache_path = ""

    # image_source_url - (Optional) This is the url of the raw image that will  be downloaded in the `image_cache_path` before being uploaded to Glance.  Glance is able to download image from internet but the `gophercloud` library  does not yet provide a way to do so.  Conflicts with `local_file_path`.
    image_source_url = ""

    # min_disk_gb - (Optional) Amount of disk space (in GB) required to boot image.  Defaults to 0.
    min_disk_gb = ""

    # min_ram_mb - (Optional) Amount of ram (in MB) required to boot image.  Defauts to 0.
    min_ram_mb = ""

    # protected - (Optional) If true, image will not be deletable.  Defaults to false.
    protected = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Glance client.   A Glance client is needed to create an Image that can be used with   a compute instance. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider   is used. Changing this creates a new Image.
    region = ""

    # tags - (Optional) The tags of the image. It must be a list of strings.   At this time, it is not possible to delete all tags of an image.
    tags = ""

    # visibility - (Optional) The visibility of the image. Must be one of  "public", "private", "community", or "shared". The ability to set the  visibility depends upon the configuration of the FlexibleEngine cloud.
    visibility = ""

    # "id" - A unique ID assigned by Glance.

flexibleengine-resource-lb-certificate-v.body:
resource "flexibleengine_lb_certificate_v2" "$1" {
    # certificate - (Required) The public encrypted key of the Certificate, PEM format.
    certificate = ""

    # private_key - (Required) The private encrypted key of the Certificate, PEM format.
    private_key = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.   A Networking client is needed to create an LB certificate. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   LB certificate.
    region = ""

    # name - (Optional) Human-readable name for the Certificate. Does not have   to be unique.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Human-readable description for the Certificate.
    description = ""

    # domain - (Optional) The domain of the Certificate.
    domain = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "certificate" - (Required) The public encrypted key of the Certificate, PEM format.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "certificate" - (Required) The public encrypted key of the Certificate, PEM format.
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "certificate" - (Required) The public encrypted key of the Certificate, PEM format.

    # max_retries - (Required) Number of permissible ping failures before   changing the member's status to INACTIVE. Must be a number between 1   and 10..
    max_retries = ""

    timeout = ""

    # delay - (Required) The time, in seconds, between sending probes to members.
    delay = ""

    # type - (Required) The type of probe, which is PING, TCP, HTTP, or HTTPS,   that is sent by the load balancer to verify the member state. Changing this   creates a new monitor.
    type = ""

    # pool_id - (Required) The id of the pool that this monitor will be assigned to.
    pool_id = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
    region = ""

    name = ""

    tenant_id = ""

    # url_path - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. URI path that will be   accessed if monitor type is HTTP or HTTPS.
    url_path = ""

    # http_method - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. The HTTP method used  for requests by the monitor. If this attribute is not specified, it  defaults to "GET".
    http_method = ""

    # expected_codes - (Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. Expected HTTP codes   for a passing HTTP(S) monitor. You can either specify a single status like   "200", or a range like "200-202".

    # submit_job_once_cluster_run - (Required) true: A job is submitted when a   cluster is created. false: A job is submitted separately. The parameter is set   to true in this example.
    submit_job_once_cluster_run = ""

    # jar_path - (Required) Path of the .jar file or .sql file for program execution   The parameter must meet the following requirements: Contains a maximum of 1023   characters, excluding special characters such as ;|&><'$. The clusters can be deleted at any time. It is recommended when data   computing is not frequently performed. Integration of data storage and computing:   Data is stored in the HDFS system. The address cannot be empty or full of spaces. Starts with / or s3a://.   Ends with .sql. sql is case-insensitive.
}

The parameter contains a maximum of 2047 characters,   excluding special characters such as ;|&>'<$, and can be empty.

Associates a floating IP to a port. This is useful for situations
where you have a pre-allocated floating IP or are unable to use the
`flexibleengine_networking_floatingip_v2` resource to create a floating IP.

A Networking client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with   another networking resource, such as a load balancer. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).
    region = ""

    # port_id - (Optional) ID of an existing port with at least one IP address to   associate with this floating IP.

    # "tenant_id" - the ID of the tenant in which to create the floating IP.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    # "fixed_ip" - The fixed IP which the floating IP maps to.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
}
flexibleengine-resource-networking-float.description:
Manages a V2 floating IP resource within FlexibleEngine Neutron (networking)
that can be used for load balancers.
These are similar to Nova (compute) floating IP resources,
but only compute floating IPs can be used with compute instances.

flexibleengine-resource-networking-secgr.description:
Manages a V2 neutron security group rule resource within FlexibleEngine.
Unlike Nova security groups, neutron separates the group from the rules
and also allows an admin to target a specific tenant_id.

flexibleengine-resource-networking-subne.body:
resource "flexibleengine_networking_subnet_v2" "$1" {
    # next_hop - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    next_hop = ""

    # destination_cidr - (Required) The destination CIDR.
    destination_cidr = ""

    # end - (Required) The ending addresss.
    end = ""

    # start - (Required) The starting address.
    start = ""

    # cidr - (Required) CIDR representing IP range for this subnet, based on IP   version. Changing this creates a new subnet.
    cidr = ""

    # network_id - (Required) The UUID of the parent network. Changing this   creates a new subnet.
    network_id = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.   A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron subnet. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   subnet.
    region = ""

    # ip_version - (Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this creates a   new subnet.
    ip_version = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the subnet. Changing this updates the name of   the existing subnet.
    name = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the subnet. Required if admin wants to   create a subnet for another tenant. Changing this creates a new subnet.
    tenant_id = ""

    # allocation_pools - (Optional) An array of sub-ranges of CIDR available for   dynamic allocation to ports. The allocation_pool object structure is   documented below. Changing this creates a new subnet.
    allocation_pools = ""

    # gateway_ip - (Optional)  Default gateway used by devices in this subnet.   Leaving this blank and not setting `no_gateway` will cause a default   gateway of `.1` to be used. Changing this updates the gateway IP of the   existing subnet.
    gateway_ip = ""

    # no_gateway - (Optional) Do not set a gateway IP on this subnet. Changing   this removes or adds a default gateway IP of the existing subnet.
    no_gateway = ""

    # enable_dhcp - (Optional) The administrative state of the network.   Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value enables or   disables the DHCP capabilities of the existing subnet. Defaults to true.
    enable_dhcp = ""

    # dns_nameservers - (Optional) An array of DNS name server names used by hosts   in this subnet. Changing this updates the DNS name servers for the existing   subnet.
    dns_nameservers = ""

    # host_routes - (Optional) An array of routes that should be used by devices   with IPs from this subnet (not including local subnet route). The host_route   object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the host routes   for the existing subnet.
    host_routes = ""

    # value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    value_specs = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "network_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "cidr" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "ip_version" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "tenant_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "allocation_pools" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "gateway_ip" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "enable_dhcp" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "dns_nameservers" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "host_routes" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
}

flexibleengine-resource-rds-instance-v1.body:
resource "flexibleengine_rds_instance_v1" "$1" {
    # size - (Required) Specifies the volume size.   Its value must be a multiple of 10 and the value range is 100 GB to 2000 GB.
    size = ""

    # id - (Required) Specifies the ID obtained from the securitygroup.
    id = ""

    # size - (Required) Specifies the volume size.   Its value must be a multiple of 10 and the value range is 100 GB to 2000 GB.
    size = ""

    # size - (Required) Specifies the volume size.   Its value must be a multiple of 10 and the value range is 100 GB to 2000 GB.
    size = ""

    # type - (Required) Specifies the volume type. Valid value:   It must be COMMON (SATA) or ULTRAHIGH (SSD) and is case-sensitive.
    type = ""

    # version - (Required) Specifies the DB instance version.
    version = ""

    # version - (Required) Specifies the DB instance version.
    version = ""

    # type - (Required) Specifies the DB engine. Currently, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and   Microsoft SQL Server are supported. The value is MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQLServer.
    type = ""

    # dbrtpd - (Required) Specifies the password for user root of the database.
    dbrtpd = ""

    # securitygroup - (Required) Specifies the security group which the RDS DB   instance belongs to. The structure is described below.
    securitygroup = ""

    # nics - (Required) Specifies the nics information. For details about how   to obtain this parameter value, see section "Subnet" in the Virtual Private   Cloud API Reference. The structure is described below.
    nics = ""

    # vpc - (Required) Specifies the VPC ID. For details about how to obtain this   parameter value, see section "Virtual Private Cloud" in the Virtual Private   Cloud API Reference.
    vpc = ""

    # availabilityzone - (Required) Specifies the ID of the AZ.
    availabilityzone = ""

    # region - (Required) Specifies the region ID.
    region = ""

    # volume - (Required) Specifies the volume information. The structure is described   below.
    volume = ""

    # flavorref - (Required) Specifies the specification ID (flavors.id in the   response message in Obtaining All DB Instance Specifications). If you want 	to enable ha for the rds instance, a flavor with ha speccode is required.
    flavorref = ""

    # datastore - (Required) Specifies database information. The structure is   described below.
    datastore = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the DB instance name. The DB instance name of   the same type is unique in the same tenant. The changes of the instance name 	will be suppressed in HA scenario.
    name = ""

    # dbport - (Optional) Specifies the database port number.
    dbport = ""

    # backupstrategy - (Optional) Specifies the advanced backup policy. The structure   is described below.
    backupstrategy = ""

    # ha - (Optional) Specifies the parameters configured on HA and is used when   creating HA DB instances. The structure is described below. NOTICE:   RDS for Microsoft SQL Server does not support creating HA DB instances and   this parameter is not involved.
    ha = ""

    # starttime - (Optional) Indicates the backup start time that has been set.   The backup task will be triggered within one hour after the backup start time.   Valid value: The value cannot be empty. It must use the hh:mm:ss format and   must be valid. The current time is the UTC time.
    starttime = ""

    # keepdays - (Optional) Specifies the number of days to retain the generated backup files.   Its value range is 0 to 35. If this parameter is not specified or set to 0, the   automated backup policy is disabled.
    keepdays = ""

    # enable - (Optional) Specifies the configured parameters on the HA.   Valid value: The value is true or false. The value true indicates creating   HA DB instances. The value false indicates creating a single DB instance.
    enable = ""

    # replicationmode - (Optional) Specifies the replication mode for the standby DB instance.   The value cannot be empty.   For MySQL, the value is async or semisync.   For PostgreSQL, the value is async or sync.
    replicationmode = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "volume.size" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "flavorref" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backupstrategy" - See Argument Reference above.
}
flexibleengine-resource-rds-instance-v1.description: Manages rds instance resource within FlexibleEngine

flexibleengine-resource-rts-software-con.description: In addition to all arguments above, the following attributes are exported: `id` - The id of the software config. # Import Software Config can be imported using the `config id`, e.g.  $ terraform import flexibleengine_rts_software_config_v1 4779ab1c-7c1a-44b1-a02e-93dfc361b32d

flexibleengine-resource-rts-stack-v1.body:
resource "resource_flexibleengine_rts_stack_v1" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) A unique name for the stack. The value must meet the regular expression rule (`^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_.-]{0,254}$`). Changing this creates a new stack.
    name = ""

    # template_body - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `template_url` is empty) Structure containing the template body. The template content must use the yaml syntax.
    template_body = ""

    # template_url - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `template_body` is empty) Location of a file containing the template body.
    template_url = ""

    # environment - (Optional) Tthe environment information about the stack.
    environment = ""

    # files - (Optional) Files used in the environment.
    files = ""

    # parameters - (Optional) A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters for the stack.
    parameters = ""

    # disable_rollback - (Optional) Set to true to disable rollback of the stack if stack creation failed.
    disable_rollback = ""

    # timeout_mins - (Optional) Specifies the timeout duration.
    timeout_mins = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "outputs" - A map of outputs from the stack.
    # "capabilities" - List of stack capabilities for stack.
    # "notification_topics" - List of notification topics for stack.
    # "status" - Specifies the stack status.
}

flexibleengine-resource-s3-bucket.body:
resource "flexibleengine_s3_bucket" "$1" {
    # bucket - (Required) The ARN of the S3 bucket where you want Amazon S3 to store replicas of the object identified by the rule.
    bucket = ""

    # status - (Required) The status of the rule. Either `Enabled` or `Disabled`. The rule is ignored if status is not Enabled.
    status = ""

    # prefix - (Required) Object keyname prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies. Set as an empty string to replicate the whole bucket.
    prefix = ""

    # destination - (Required) Specifies the destination for the rule (documented below).
    destination = ""

    # days - (Required) Specifies the number of days an object is noncurrent object versions expire.
    days = ""

    # enabled - (Required) Specifies lifecycle rule status.
    enabled = ""

    # target_bucket - (Required) The name of the bucket that will receive the log objects.
    target_bucket = ""

    # allowed_origins - (Required) Specifies which origins are allowed.
    allowed_origins = ""

    # allowed_methods - (Required) Specifies which methods are allowed. Can be `GET`, `PUT`, `POST`, `DELETE` or `HEAD`.
    allowed_methods = ""

    # bucket - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The name of the bucket. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique name.
    bucket = ""

    # bucket_prefix - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Creates a unique bucket name beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with `bucket`.
    bucket_prefix = ""

    # acl - (Optional) The [canned ACL](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl) to apply. Defaults to "private".
    acl = ""

    # policy - (Optional) A valid [bucket policy](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/example-bucket-policies.html) JSON document. Note that if the policy document is not specific enough (but still valid), Terraform may view the policy as constantly changing in a `terraform plan`. In this case, please make sure you use the verbose/specific version of the policy.
    policy = ""

    # force_destroy - (Optional) (Optional, Default:false ) A boolean that indicates all objects should be deleted from the bucket so that the bucket can be destroyed without error. These objects are *not* recoverable.
    force_destroy = ""

    # website - (Optional) A website object (documented below).
    website = ""

    # cors_rule - (Optional) A rule of [Cross-Origin Resource Sharing](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/cors.html) (documented below).
    cors_rule = ""

    # versioning - (Optional) A state of [versioning](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/Versioning.html) (documented below)
    versioning = ""

    # logging - (Optional) A settings of [bucket logging](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/UG/ManagingBucketLogging.html) (documented below).
    logging = ""

    # lifecycle_rule - (Optional) A configuration of [object lifecycle management](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/object-lifecycle-mgmt.html) (documented below).
    lifecycle_rule = ""

    # region - (Optional) If specified, the region this bucket should reside in. Otherwise, the region used by the callee.
    region = ""

    # index_document - (Optional) (Required, unless using `redirect_all_requests_to`) Amazon S3 returns this index document when requests are made to the root domain or any of the subfolders.
    index_document = ""

    # error_document - (Optional) An absolute path to the document to return in case of a 4XX error.
    error_document = ""

    # redirect_all_requests_to - (Optional) A hostname to redirect all website requests for this bucket to. Hostname can optionally be prefixed with a protocol (`http://` or `https://`) to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol that is used in the original request.
    redirect_all_requests_to = ""

    # routing_rules - (Optional) A json array containing [routing rules](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-s3-websiteconfiguration-routingrules.html)
    routing_rules = ""

    # allowed_headers - (Optional) Specifies which headers are allowed.
    allowed_headers = ""

    # expose_headers - (Optional) Specifies expose header in the response.
    expose_headers = ""

    # max_age_seconds - (Optional) Specifies time in seconds that browser can cache the response for a preflight request.
    max_age_seconds = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Enable versioning. Once you version-enable a bucket, it can never return to an unversioned state. You can, however, suspend versioning on that bucket.
    enabled = ""

    # mfa_delete - (Optional) Enable MFA delete for either `Change the versioning state of your bucket` or `Permanently delete an object version`. Default is `false`.
    mfa_delete = ""

    # target_prefix - (Optional) To specify a key prefix for log objects.
    target_prefix = ""

    # id - (Optional) Unique identifier for the rule.
    id = ""

    # prefix - (Optional) Object key prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.
    prefix = ""

    # abort_incomplete_multipart_upload_days - (Optional) Specifies the number of days after initiating a multipart upload when the multipart upload must be completed.
    abort_incomplete_multipart_upload_days = ""

    # expiration - (Optional) Specifies a period in the object's expire (documented below).
    expiration = ""

    # noncurrent_version_expiration - (Optional) Specifies when noncurrent object versions expire (documented below).
    noncurrent_version_expiration = ""

    # date - (Optional) Specifies the date after which you want the corresponding action to take effect.
    date = ""

    # days - (Optional) Specifies the number of days after object creation when the specific rule action takes effect.
    days = ""

    # expired_object_delete_marker - (Optional) On a versioned bucket (versioning-enabled or versioning-suspended bucket), you can add this element in the lifecycle configuration to direct Amazon S3 to delete expired object delete markers.
    expired_object_delete_marker = ""

    # id - (Optional) Unique identifier for the rule.
    id = ""

    # storage_class - (Optional) The class of storage used to store the object.
    storage_class = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The name of the bucket.
    # "arn" - The ARN of the bucket. Will be of format "arn:aws:s3:::bucketname".
    # "bucket_domain_name" - The bucket domain name. Will be of format "bucketname.s3.amazonaws.com".
    # "hosted_zone_id" - The [Route 53 Hosted Zone ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#s3_website_region_endpoints) for this bucket's region.
    # "region" - The region this bucket resides in.
    # "website_endpoint" - The website endpoint, if the bucket is configured with a website. If not, this will be an empty string.
    # "website_domain" - The domain of the website endpoint, if the bucket is configured with a website. If not, this will be an empty string. This is used to create Route 53 alias records.
}

flexibleengine-resource-s3-bucket-object.body:
resource "flexibleengine_s3_bucket_object" "$1" {
    # source - (Required) The path to the source file being uploaded to the bucket.
    source = ""

    # key - (Required) The name of the object once it is in the bucket.
    key = ""

    # bucket - (Required) The name of the bucket to put the file in.
    bucket = ""

    # content - (Optional) (Required unless `source` given) The literal content being uploaded to the bucket.
    content = ""

    # acl - (Optional) The [canned ACL](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl) to apply. Defaults to "private".
    acl = ""

    # cache_control - (Optional) Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain Read [w3c cache_control](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.9) for further details.
    cache_control = ""

    # content_disposition - (Optional) Specifies presentational information for the object. Read [wc3 content_disposition](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec19.html#sec19.5.1) for further information.
    content_disposition = ""

    # content_encoding - (Optional) Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field. Read [w3c content encoding](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.11) for further information.
    content_encoding = ""

    # content_language - (Optional) The language the content is in e.g. en-US or en-GB.
    content_language = ""

    # content_type - (Optional) A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data, e.g. application/octet-stream. All Valid MIME Types are valid for this input.
    content_type = ""

    # website_redirect - (Optional) Specifies a target URL for [website redirect](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/how-to-page-redirect.html).
    website_redirect = ""

    # etag - (Optional) Used to trigger updates. The only meaningful value is `${md5(file("path/to/file"))}`.
    etag = ""

    # server_side_encryption - (Optional) Specifies server-side encryption of the object in S3. Valid values are "`AES256`" and "`aws:kms`".
    server_side_encryption = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - the "key" of the resource supplied above
    # "etag" - the ETag generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content).
    # "version_id" - A unique version ID value for the object, if bucket versioning
}
flexibleengine-resource-s3-bucket-object.description: Provides a S3 bucket object resource.

flexibleengine-resource-s3-bucket-policy.body:
resource "flexibleengine_s3_bucket_policy" "$1" {

flexibleengine-resource-sfs-file-system-.body:
resource "flexibleengine_sfs_file_system_v2" "$1" {
    # access_to - (Required) The access that the back end grants or denies. Changing this will create a new access rule
    access_to = ""

    # access_level - (Required) The access level of the shared file system. Changing this will create a new access rule.
    access_level = ""

    # size - (Required) The size (GB) of the shared file system.
    size = ""

    # share_proto - (Optional) The protocol for sharing file systems. The default value is NFS.
    share_proto = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the shared file system.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Describes the shared file system.
    description = ""

    # is_public - (Optional) The level of visibility for the shared file system.
    is_public = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Metadata key and value pairs as a dictionary of strings.Changing this will create a new resource.
    metadata = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone name.Changing this parameter will create a new resource.
    availability_zone = ""

    # access_type - (Optional) The type of the share access rule. Changing this will create a new access rule.
    access_type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The UUID of the shared file system.
    # "status" - The status of the shared file system.
    # "share_type" - The storage service type assigned for the shared file system, such as high-performance storage (composed of SSDs) and large-capacity storage (composed of SATA disks).
    # "volume_type" - The volume type.
    # "export_location" - The address for accessing the shared file system.
    # "host" - The host name of the shared file system.
    # "share_access_id" - The UUID of the share access rule.
    # "access_rules_status" - The status of the share access rule.
}
flexibleengine-resource-sfs-file-system-.description: Provides an Shared File System (SFS) resource.

flexibleengine-resource-smn-subscription.body:
resource "flexibleengine_smn_subscription_v2" "$1" {
    # protocol - (Required) Protocol of the message endpoint. Currently, email,    sms, http, and https are supported.
    protocol = ""

    # endpoint - (Required) Message endpoint.    For an HTTP subscription, the endpoint starts with http\://.    For an HTTPS subscription, the endpoint starts with https\://.    For an email subscription, the endpoint is a mail address.    For an SMS message subscription, the endpoint is a phone number.
    endpoint = ""

    # topic_urn - (Required) Resource identifier of a topic, which is unique.
    topic_urn = ""

    # remark - (Optional) Remark information. The remarks must be a UTF-8-coded    character string containing 128 bytes.
    remark = ""

    # subscription_urn - (Optional) Resource identifier of a subscription, which    is unique.
    subscription_urn = ""

    # owner - (Optional) Project ID of the topic creator.
    owner = ""

    # status - (Optional) Subscription status.    0 indicates that the subscription is not confirmed.    1 indicates that the subscription is confirmed.    3 indicates that the subscription is canceled.
    status = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "topic_urn" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - (Optional) Subscription status.    0 indicates that the subscription is not confirmed.    1 indicates that the subscription is confirmed.    3 indicates that the subscription is canceled.
    # "endpoint" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - (Optional) Subscription status.    0 indicates that the subscription is not confirmed.    1 indicates that the subscription is confirmed.    3 indicates that the subscription is canceled.
    # "protocol" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - (Optional) Subscription status.    0 indicates that the subscription is not confirmed.    1 indicates that the subscription is confirmed.    3 indicates that the subscription is canceled.
    # "remark" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - (Optional) Subscription status.    0 indicates that the subscription is not confirmed.    1 indicates that the subscription is confirmed.    3 indicates that the subscription is canceled.
    # "subscription_urn" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - (Optional) Subscription status.    0 indicates that the subscription is not confirmed.    1 indicates that the subscription is confirmed.    3 indicates that the subscription is canceled.
    # "owner" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - (Optional) Subscription status.    0 indicates that the subscription is not confirmed.    1 indicates that the subscription is confirmed.    3 indicates that the subscription is canceled.
    # "status" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - (Optional) Subscription status.    0 indicates that the subscription is not confirmed.    1 indicates that the subscription is confirmed.    3 indicates that the subscription is canceled.
}
flexibleengine-resource-smn-subscription.description: Manages a V2 subscription resource within FlexibleEngine.

flexibleengine-resource-smn-topic-v2.body:
resource "flexibleengine_smn_topic_v2" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the topic to be created.

flexibleengine-resource-vbs-backup-polic.description: Backup Policy can be imported using the `id`, e.g. $ terraform import flexibleengine_vbs_backup_policy_v2.vbs 4779ab1c-7c1a-44b1-a02e-93dfc361b32d

flexibleengine-resource-vpc-eip-v1.body:
resource "flexibleengine_vpc_eip_v1" "$1" {
    # share_type - (Required) Whether the bandwidth is shared or exclusive. Changing   this creates a new eip.
    share_type = ""

    # size - (Required) The bandwidth size. The value ranges from 1 to 300 Mbit/s.
    size = ""

    # name - (Required) The bandwidth name, which is a string of 1 to 64 characters   that contain letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # type - (Required) The value must be a type supported by the system. Only   `5_bgp` supported now. Changing this creates a new eip.
    type = ""

    # bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth object.
    bandwidth = ""

    # publicip - (Required) The elastic IP address object.
    publicip = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the eip. If omitted,   the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new eip.
    region = ""

    # ip_address - (Optional) The value must be a valid IP address in the available   IP address segment. Changing this creates a new eip.
    ip_address = ""

    # port_id - (Optional) The port id which this eip will associate with. If the value   is "" or this not specified, the eip will be in unbind state.
    port_id = ""

    # charge_mode - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
    charge_mode = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "charge_mode" - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
    # "publicip/type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "charge_mode" - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
    # "publicip/ip_address" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "charge_mode" - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
    # "publicip/port_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "charge_mode" - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
    # "bandwidth/name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "charge_mode" - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
    # "bandwidth/size" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "charge_mode" - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
    # "bandwidth/share_type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "charge_mode" - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
    # "bandwidth/charge_mode" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "charge_mode" - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
}
flexibleengine-resource-vpc-eip-v1.description: Manages a V1 EIP resource within FlexibleEngine VPC.

flexibleengine-resource-vpc-peering-acce.body:
resource "resource_flexibleengine_vpc_peering_connection_accepter_v2" "$1" {
    # vpc_peering_connection_id - (Required) - The VPC Peering Connection ID to manage. Changing this creates a new VPC peering connection accepter.
    vpc_peering_connection_id = ""

    # accept - (Optional) 
    accept = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "name" - 	The VPC peering connection name.
    # "id" - The VPC peering connection ID.
    # "status" - The VPC peering connection status.
    # "vpc_id" - The ID of requester VPC involved in a VPC peering connection.
    # "peer_vpc_id" - The VPC ID of the accepter tenant.
    # "peer_tenant_id" - The Tenant Id of the accepter tenant.
}
flexibleengine-resource-vpc-peering-acce.description:
Provides a resource to manage the accepter's side of a VPC Peering Connection. When a cross-tenant (requester's tenant differs from the accepter's tenant) VPC Peering Connection is created, a VPC Peering Connection resource is automatically created in the
accepter's account.
The requester can use the `flexibleengine_vpc_peering_connection_v2` resource to manage its side of the connection
and the accepter can use the `flexibleengine_vpc_peering_connection_accepter_v2` resource to "adopt" its side of the
connection into management.

flexibleengine-resource-vpc-peering-v2.body:
resource "flexibleengine_vpc_peering_connection_v2" "$1" {
    # peer_vpc_id - (Required) - Specifies the VPC ID of the accepter tenant. Changing this creates a new VPC peering connection.
    peer_vpc_id = ""

    # vpc_id - (Required) - Specifies the ID of a VPC involved in a VPC peering connection. Changing this creates a new VPC peering connection.
    vpc_id = ""

    # name - (Required) - Specifies the name of the VPC peering connection. The value can contain 1 to 64 characters.
    name = ""

    # peer_tenant_id - (Optional) - Specified the Tenant Id of the accepter tenant. Changing this creates a new VPC peering connection. ## Attributes Reference
    peer_tenant_id = ""

    # id - (Optional) The VPC peering connection ID.
    id = ""

    # status - (Optional) The VPC peering connection status. The value can be PENDING_ACCEPTANCE, REJECTED, EXPIRED, DELETED, or ACTIVE.
    status = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
flexibleengine-resource-vpc-peering-v2.description: Provides a resource to manage a VPC Peering Connection resource. -> **Note:** For cross-tenant (requester's tenant differs from the accepter's tenant) VPC Peering Connections, use the `flexibleengine_vpc_peering_connection_v2` resource to manage the requester's side of the connection and use the `flexibleengine_vpc_peering_connection_accepter_v2` resource to manage the accepter's side of the connection.

flexibleengine-resource-vpc-route-v2.body:
resource "flexibleengine_vpc_route_v2" "$1" {
    # vpc_id - (Required) - Specifies the VPC for which a route is to be added. Changing this creates a new Route.
    vpc_id = ""

    # type - (Required) - Specifies the route type. Currently, the value can only be **peering**. Changing this creates a new Route.
    type = ""

    # nexthop - (Required) - Specifies the next hop. If the route type is peering, enter the VPC peering connection ID. Changing this creates a new Route.
    nexthop = ""

    # destination - (Required) - Specifies the destination IP address or CIDR block. Changing this creates a new Route.
    destination = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) - Specifies the tenant ID. Only the administrator can specify the tenant ID of other tenant. Changing this creates a new Route.
    tenant_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The route ID.
    # "tenant_id" (Optional) - Specifies the tenant ID. Only the administrator can specify the tenant ID of other tenant. Changing this creates a new Route.
}
flexibleengine-resource-vpc-route-v2.description: Provides a resource to create a route.

flexibleengine-resource-vpc-subnet-v1.description: Subnets can be imported using the `subnet id`, e.g.  $ terraform import flexibleengine_vpc_subnet_v1 4779ab1c-7c1a-44b1-a02e-93dfc361b32d

flexibleengine-resource-vpc-v1.body:
resource "flexibleengine_vpc_v1" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the VPC. The name must be unique for a tenant. The value is a string of no more than 64 characters and can contain digits, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). Changing this updates the name of the existing VPC.
    name = ""

    # cidr - (Required) The range of available subnets in the VPC. The value ranges from 10.0.0.0/8 to 10.255.255.0/24, 172.16.0.0/12 to 172.31.255.0/24, or 192.168.0.0/16 to 192.168.255.0/24.
    cidr = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V1 VPC client. A VPC client is needed to create a VPC. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new VPC.
    region = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" -  ID of the VPC.
    # "name" -  See Argument Reference above.
    # "cidr" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - The current status of the desired VPC. Can be either CREATING, OK, DOWN, PENDING_UPDATE, PENDING_DELETE, or ERROR.
    # "shared" - Specifies whether the cross-tenant sharing is supported.
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
}
flexibleengine-resource-vpc-v1.description: Manages a VPC resource within FlexibleEngine.
